result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Horacio C. Rubio is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

On one or more charges in this case, Horacio C. Rubio was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

for Placement
Criminal Case Settlement

[MA]Case called at 10:34am
Defendant Horacio C. Rubio in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Shawna Stevenoski-sworn as Spanish Interpreter

The Court aknowledges receipt and review of letter from ADA Shock to Atty. De La Rosa re: Criminal Case Settlement
--Atty. De La Rosa indicates that this is the settlement that the parties have agreed to

The Court and Defendant review the Criminal Case Settlement and Plea Questionnaire
The Defendant indicates would like time to speak with Atty. De La Rosa

recess: 10:50am--receonve: 11:11am
Mr. Rubio indicates that he has now had enough time to review the plea questionnaire with Atty. De La Rosa

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " No Contest and Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease/Defect " entered on Counts #2, #4, #5 and #6 of the Information ; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified--ADA Beck notifies Court that victim impact statement has been submitted; the Court accepts pleas, finds the Defendant guilty, but not guilty by reason of mental disease/defect on each count

As to Counts #1 and 3, On Motion of State the Dismisses outright.

The State waives the right to present any further evidence, and is in agreement with the report of Dr. Freiburger.
Atty. De La Rosa cites 971.17(1)(d) and 971.17(2)(a), and 973.17(3) which give Court authority to proceed, without further input from DHS.
The Court concludes that the report of Dr. Freiburger provides enough information for the Court to proceed today. 

Commitment arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Rubio

The Court orders Mr. Rubio to be committed to DHS for 6 months, on each count, consecutive to eachother, for a total of 24 months. 
The Defendant is granted 158 days credit

recess: 11:41am
Status conference on May 1, 2017 at 10:30 am.
